Article/0-0-0-18/context-instances.title: Context Instances
Article/0-0-0-18/context-instances.html:
• Type: object<\/code><\/li>
  • Origin: Nullstack Context<\/a><\/li>
  • Availability: client<\/strong><\/li>
  • readwrite<\/strong> in client<\/strong> context<\/li> <\/ul>

    It gives you all active instances of the application.<\/p>

    ðŸ’¡ Active instances are the ones created and not yet terminated<\/a><\/p> <\/blockquote>

    As explained in instance key<\/code><\/a>, keys play a big role in defining a unique identifier for components.<\/p>

    ðŸ”¥ Nullstack trusts its developers to know what they are doing and exposes as much internal behavior for the programmer to do as it wishes, use with caution.<\/p> <\/blockquote>

    The default key for class components is a join between the class name and the dom depth like Counter/1.1<\/code> and are hard for humans to interact with.<\/p>

    The first component of your application will have the key application<\/code> by default.<\/p>

    ðŸ’¡ keys define which instance will be used to render the component, you can use it to force a node to reinstantiate.<\/p> <\/blockquote>

    Adding an unique key<\/code> to Counter<\/strong> makes it easier to access on instances<\/code> list:<\/p> 

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> Counter from<\/span> './Counter'<\/span>;<\/span>
import<\/span> AnyOtherComponent from<\/span> './AnyOtherComponent'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Application<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>Counter<\/span><\/span> key<\/span>=<\/span>"<\/span>counter"<\/span><\/span> /><\/span><\/span>
        <<\/span>AnyOtherComponent<\/span><\/span>/><\/span><\/span>
      </<\/span>main<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Application;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> Counter<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  value =<\/span> 0<\/span>;<\/span>

  increment<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    this<\/span>.<\/span>value++<\/span>;<\/span>
  }<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> <<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span> Count<\/span>:<\/span> {<\/span>this<\/span>.<\/span>value}<\/span> </<\/span>p<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> Counter;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    You can access any methods and instance variables from counter<\/strong> instance on AnyOtherComponent<\/strong>:<\/p>

    import<\/span> Nullstack from<\/span> 'nullstack'<\/span>;<\/span>

class<\/span> AnyOtherComponent<\/span> extends<\/span> Nullstack<\/span> {<\/span>

  render<\/span>(<\/span>{<\/span> instances }<\/span><\/span>)<\/span> {<\/span>
    return<\/span> (<\/span>
      <<\/span>button<\/span> onclick<\/span>=<\/span>{<\/span>instances.<\/span>counter.<\/span>increment}<\/span><\/span>><\/span><\/span>
        Add 1<\/span> to {<\/span>instances.<\/span>counter.<\/span>value}<\/span>
      </<\/span>button<\/span>><\/span><\/span>
    )<\/span>
  }<\/span>

}<\/span>

export<\/span> default<\/span> AnyOtherComponent;<\/span>
<\/code><\/pre>

    The use of instances<\/code> unlocks unlimited custom behaviors like:<\/p>

      

    • A notification icon at the navbar that can be updated from other components at certain actions<\/li>

    • A toast<\/em> component that can be invoked from anywhere in your application<\/li>

    • A store<\/em> system with custom dispatch methods similar to Redux<\/li>

    • Something we haven't even imagined, dream on and post your ideas on GitHub!<\/li>
<\/ul>
Article/0-0-0-18/context-instances.description: The instances object is a proxy in the Nullstack Context available in the client and gives you all active instances in the application
